intro: Erythrocoma affinis, commonly known as the redstem erythrocoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Erythrocoma affinis typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
